sentences.english: So that they can hear her over their headsets.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過自己的耳麥聽到講師的聲音。

sentences.english: If you have headsets of your own, bring those too as many airplanes have TV's these days.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有耳麥請帶上它，因爲許多飛機現在裝有電視。

sentences.english: The job of getting a character to say something through the loudspeakers or headphones is given to the producer.
sentences.chinese: 讓人物通過擴音器或耳麥說話的工作由製作器負責。

sentences.english: Blue tooth and headsets are among the recommended precautions experts are suggesting.
sentences.chinese: 藍牙設備和耳麥是專家們推薦的預防措施。

sentences.english: Refer to your Bluetooth headsetâ ™s manual to find the passkey for your headset.
sentences.chinese: 請參考藍牙耳麥的手冊，找到這個密鑰。

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
to return something to its rightful owner
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
